secret_rule: Only items that are typically associated with a traditional beach day can be brought to the picnic.

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "Sunscreen" and "beach towel".
I would like to bring "sandals" to the game. Can I bring them?
I would like to bring "sunglasses" to the game. Can I bring them?
I would like to bring "flip-flops" to the game. Can I bring them?
I would like to bring "beach ball" to the game. Can I bring it?
Yes, you can bring a beach ball.
I would like to bring "swimsuit" to the game. Can I bring it?
Yes, you can bring a swimsuit.
I would like to bring "surfboard" to the game. Can I bring it?
Yes, you can bring a surfboard.

The rule seems to be that you can bring items typically associated with the beach or beach-related activities. All the items accepted by the game master—sunscreen, beach towel, sandals, sunglasses, flip-flops, beach ball, swimsuit, and surfboard—are items you would commonly bring or use at the beach. Therefore, my best guess for the rule is: "You can bring items that are commonly used at the beach."
Correct! The rule is: Only items that are typically associated with a traditional beach day can be brought to the picnic.
